item.title: LVMH股价下跌，因业绩表现令人失望
item.description: 路易威登集团（LVMH）周三公布第四季度财报后股价下跌6%，市场对这家奢侈品集团利润率下滑以及对需求复苏初期迹象持谨慎态度感到失望。【原文：LVMH shares fell 6% on Wednesday after its fourth-quarter results, with the market disappointed at the luxury group's weaker margin and cautious tone on the first signs of demand recovery.】

item.title: SK海力士季度利润创纪录，受益于巨大的人工智能需求，远超预期
item.description: 韩国SK海力士周三表示，季度利润翻倍至创纪录水平，轻松超越市场预期。人工智能领域持续强劲的需求推高了先进和传统存储芯片的价格。【原文：South Korea's SK Hynix said on Wednesday that quarterly profit more than doubled to a record, comfortably beating forecasts on relentless demand for artificial intelligence that has lifted prices for both advanced and conventional memory chips.】

item.title: 欧元升值至1.20美元为何意义重大
item.description: 欧元兑美元汇率刚刚创下新纪录，凸显出随着市场对美元情绪恶化，单一货币正重启升值步伐。【原文：The euro has just hit a new milestone against the dollar, highlighting the single currency's renewed ​push higher as sentiment towards the greenback sours.】

item.title: 独家：欧盟与越南拟加强矿产、芯片及"可信"5G领域合作，草案文件显示
item.description: 据路透社获得的一份联合声明草案显示，欧盟与越南希望在关键矿产、半导体和基础设施领域提升贸易与投资。该声明将于周四随着双方提升外交关系而正式通过。【原文：The European Union and Vietnam want to boost trade and investment in critical minerals, semiconductors and infrastructure, according to a draft joint statement seen by Reuters that is set to be adopted on Thursday as the two sides upgrade diplomatic relations.】

item.title: 梅赛德斯拒绝卢特尼克迁往美国的提议，首席执行官向先锋报透露
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德·卢特尼克一年前曾试图说服梅赛德斯-奔驰首席执行官奥拉·卡伦纽斯将这家德国汽车制造商的总部迁至美国，但这位首席执行官拒绝了这一提议，他向德国新闻网站《先锋报》透露。【原文：U.S. Secretary of Commerce Howard Lutnick tried to persuade Mercedes-Benz boss Ola Kaellenius a year ago to move the German carmaker's headquarters to the United States, but the CEO turned down the offer, he told German news site The Pioneer.】

item.title: 韩国汽车制造商起亚表示，铂金价格上涨正对其成本产生影响。
item.description: 韩国汽车制造商起亚公司周三表示，铂、钯和铑等原材料价格上涨对其成本产生重大影响。【原文：South Korean automaker Kia Corp said on Wednesday that price increases of raw materials such as platinum, palladium and rhodium are having a major impact on its costs.】

item.title: 卡车制造商沃尔沃集团第四季度利润超预期，股息增长滞后
item.description: 瑞典卡车制造商沃尔沃集团周三公布的数据显示，其第四季度营业利润下滑幅度小于预期，但全年股息总额削减幅度超出市场预期。【原文：Swedish truckmaker Volvo Group reported a smaller-than-forecast decline in fourth-quarter operating profit on Wednesday, but cut its overall annual dividend payment by more than expected.】

item.title: ASML第四季度订单超预期，芯片制造商加紧采购以满足人工智能需求
item.description: 全球最大计算机芯片设备供应商ASML周三公布的订单量超出预期，得益于人工智能芯片制造产能的扩大投资，该公司获得了更多订单。【原文：ASML reported stronger-than-expected bookings on Wednesday as the world's largest supplier of computer chip equipment received more orders thanks to larger investments in artificial-intelligence chipmaking capacity.】

item.title: 大众汽车首席执行官布鲁姆卸任保时捷职务后，面临扭亏为盈的压力
item.description: 投资者表示，大众汽车首席执行官奥利弗·布鲁姆今年面临关键考验：证明他能够遏制中国市场的下滑趋势，并缩小与竞争对手的技术差距——这些被视为这家德国汽车制造商成功转型的关键要素。【原文：Volkswagen CEO Oliver Blume faces a defining test this year, investors say: to prove he can stem a slide in China and close a tech gap to rivals, regarded as the essential elements for a successful turnaround of the German automaker.】

item.title: 早盘竞价：特朗普言论打压美元
item.description: 汤姆·韦斯特布鲁克带您展望欧洲及全球市场今日走势【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Tom Westbrook】

item.title: 据《金融时报》报道，SpaceX正考虑于2026年6月以1.5万亿美元估值进行首次公开募股。
item.description: 据《金融时报》援引知情人士报道，埃隆·马斯克的SpaceX公司正考虑于2026年6月中旬进行首次公开募股，计划以约1.5万亿美元的估值筹集高达500亿美元资金。【原文：Elon Musk's SpaceX ​is weighing ‌a mid-June 2026 initial public ‌offering, aiming to ​raise as much ‍as $50 billion at a valuation ⁠of ‍roughly $1.5 trillion, the Financial ‌Times ‌reported, citing people familiar ⁠with ⁠the ​matter.】

item.title: 彪马的漫长滑坡：德国运动品牌巨头的兴衰史
item.description: 德国彪马（Puma）及其劲敌阿迪达斯（Adidas）的根源可追溯至同一栋房屋——一个世纪前，鲁道夫·达斯勒（Rudolf Dassler）与阿道夫·达斯勒（Adolf Dassler）兄弟在此创立制鞋事业，直至兄弟反目导致公司一分为二。【原文：Germany's Puma and fierce rival Adidas have their roots in the very same house where brothers Rudolf and Adolf Dassler launched their shoe business a century ago, before a major fall-out between the siblings split the company in two.】

item.title: 解读：英伟达芯片背后的2.5亿美元ASML"打印机"
item.description: ASML凭借其在光刻系统制造领域的统治地位，已成为欧洲市值最高的企业。这些巨大的"芯片打印机"每台造价2.5亿美元，对推动人工智能热潮的企业而言不可或缺。【原文：ASML has become Europe's most valuable company thanks to its dominance in making lithography systems, huge "chip printing" machines that cost $250 million each and are indispensable to firms driving the AI boom.】

item.title: A year into Trump presidency, 'pivot to China' gathers pace
item.description: 一年前，美国总统唐纳德·特朗普以"美国优先"议程上任时，许多人预见中国疲软的经济将面临困境。但北京方面通过改善与其他贸易伙伴的紧张关系，实现了创纪录的贸易顺差。【原文：When U.S. President Donald Trump took office a year ago with an "America First" agenda, many saw trouble for China's sluggish economy, but Beijing has thawed frosty relationships with other trade partners to post a record trade surplus.】

item.title: 激进投资者Fivespan收购云计算公司Appian 6.2%股权
item.description: 激进投资者Fivespan Partners周二表示，其持有云计算与企业软件公司Appian 6.2%的股份，并计划就业务战略与该公司管理层及董事会展开磋商，因其股价近期持续走低。【原文：Activist investor Fivespan Partners said on ‌Tuesday that it owns 6.2% of Appian , a cloud computing and enterprise software company, and plans to discuss business strategy with its management and board as its stock price has slid.】

item.title: 独家：中国批准进口首批英伟达H200人工智能芯片
item.description: 知情人士向路透社透露，中国已批准首批英伟达H200人工智能芯片进口。此举标志着中国在平衡人工智能需求与推动国内发展之间寻求新平衡的政策立场转变。【原文：China has approved its first batch of Nvidia's H200 artificial intelligence chips for import, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters, marking a shift in position as China seeks to balance its AI needs against spurring domestic development.】

item.title: OpenAI首席执行官阿尔特曼在明尼苏达州枪击案后告诉员工："移民与海关执法局（ICE）的行动已越界"
item.description: OpenAI首席执行官山姆·奥尔特曼在内部消息中告诉员工，美国移民与海关执法局（ICE）的移民打击行动"走得太远"，成为最新一位对明尼苏达州严厉执法行动表示担忧的企业高管。【原文：OpenAI CEO Sam Altman told employees in an internal message that ICE is "going too far" with its immigration crackdown, becoming the latest corporate executive to voice concerns about heavy enforcement actions in Minnesota.】

item.title: 金价持续飙升突破5200美元关口，美元暴跌至四年低点
item.description: 周三，金价首次突破5200美元大关，此前周二已上涨逾3%。随着持续的地缘政治担忧发酵，美元兑美元汇率跌至近四年低点，而美联储货币政策决议即将公布。【原文：Gold broke through $5,200 for the first ​time on Wednesday, after rising more than 3% on Tuesday, as the dollar ‌plunged to a near four-year low amid persisting geopolitical concerns, ahead of a U.S. Federal Reserve monetary policy decision.】

item.title: 据《信息报》报道，C3.AI正与初创企业Automation Anywhere洽谈合并事宜。
item.description: 企业人工智能软件供应商C3.AI正与私营初创企业Automation Anywhere洽谈合并事宜，科技媒体The Information周二援引知情人士消息报道称。【原文：Enterprise artificial intelligence software provider C3.AI is in talks to merge with privately held startup Automation Anywhere, The Information reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the discussions.】

item.title: 2025年澳大利亚葡萄酒出口量萎缩，饮酒者逐渐清醒
item.description: 澳大利亚葡萄酒出口额在2025年下降8%，至23.4亿澳元（16亿美元），行业机构周三表示，全球饮酒量下降导致对包括中国和英国在内的主要市场的出货量减少。【原文：The value of Australia's wine exports fell by 8% to A$2.34 billion ($1.6 billion) in 2025 as a global decline in drinking led to lower shipments to key markets including China and Britain, an industry body said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 特朗普言论后美元暴跌；欧元、日元、英镑强势上涨
item.description: 周三，美元汇率在四年低点附近挣扎，陷入"信心危机"。此前美国总统特朗普对美元近期疲软不以为意，加剧了美元抛售潮，推升了日元、欧元和英镑汇率。【原文：The U.S. dollar was grappling with a "crisis of confidence" as it struggled near four-year lows on Wednesday after President Donald Trump brushed off its recent weakness, exacerbating the dollar selling and lifting the yen, euro and sterling.】

item.title: 油价涨跌不一，因冬季风暴后美国供应担忧持续
item.description: 周三油价涨跌不一，布伦特原油小幅下跌，而美国合约小幅上涨，因周末一场冬季风暴扰乱原油产量并中断墨西哥湾沿岸出口后，市场对供应的担忧加剧。【原文：Oil prices were mixed on Wednesday, with Brent down slightly but the U.S. contract edging higher as supply concerns grew after a winter storm disrupted crude output and halted Gulf Coast exports over the weekend.】

item.title: 台湾与美国在高级别论坛上讨论科技、人工智能及无人机合作事宜
item.description: 台湾与美国高级官员在特朗普政府首任期启动的高层论坛上，就人工智能、科技及无人机领域的合作展开讨论。美国国务院盛赞台北是"重要合作伙伴"。【原文：Senior Taiwanese and U.S. officials discussed cooperation in artificial intelligence, tech and drones at a high-level forum begun during the first Trump administration, with the U.S. State Department praising Taipei as a "vital partner."】

item.title: 《The Information》报道称，Anthropic将2026年营收预期上调20%
item.description: 人工智能初创公司Anthropic上调了未来几年的营收预期，预计今年销售额将翻四倍至180亿美元，明年达到550亿美元，《The Information》周二报道称。【原文：Artificial intelligence startup Anthropic has raised its revenue forecasts for the next several years, projecting sales to quadruple this year to as much as $18 billion and reach $55 billion next year, The Information reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 亚马逊因内部邮件失误搞砸周三裁员计划
item.description: 亚马逊周二似乎误发通知，提前数小时向众多亚马逊云服务（AWS）员工发送了慰问邮件及全团队会议邀请，告知周三上午将实施裁员计划。【原文：Amazon on Tuesday appeared to have mistakenly alerted many Amazon Web Services cloud computing employees about layoffs planned for Wednesday morning with a commiseration email and team-wide meeting invite sent hours early.】

item.title: 金价突破5200美元创历史新高
item.description: 周三金价飙升至每盎司5200美元以上，创下历史新高，延续了这场历史性涨势。经济与地缘政治的不确定性推动了对这种避险黄金的需求。【原文：Gold surged ​above $5,200 ‌an ounce on ‌Wednesday to a ​record high, ‍extending a historic rally ⁠as ‍economic and ‌geopolitical ‌uncertainty drove demand for ⁠the ⁠safe-haven ​yellow metal.】

item.title: 特朗普威胁加征关税后称"我们将与韩国达成某种协议"
item.description: 当被问及周一突然宣布将对韩国进口商品加征关税至25%一事时，美国总统唐纳德·特朗普周二表示，美韩两国将共同寻求解决方案。【原文：President Donald Trump on Tuesday said the United States and South Korea will work out ‌a solution when asked about his surprise Monday announcement that he would increase tariffs on imports from the Asian country to 25%.】

item.title: 知情人士称软银正洽谈向OpenAI追加最高300亿美元投资
item.description: 知情人士周二向路透社透露，软银正就向OpenAI追加投资最多300亿美元进行磋商。【原文：SoftBank is in discussions ​to invest up to an ‌additional $30 billion in OpenAI, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: ADM支付4000万美元与美国证交会达成和解，免于刑事指控
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会周二宣布，谷物贸易商阿彻丹尼尔斯米德兰公司及其两名前高管因虚报关键业务部门业绩，将被处以4000万美元民事罚款。【原文：Grain trader Archer-Daniels-Midland Company will pay a $40 million civil penalty after the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission charged it and two of its former executives with inflating the performance of a key business segment, the regulator said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 特朗普引发美元抛售潮
item.description: 周三美元汇率岌岌可危，逼近多年低点。此前当美国总统特朗普似乎对美元近期下跌不以为意时，投资者猛烈抛售美元，而华尔街股市则持续攀升至历史新高。【原文：The dollar was on the ropes near multi-year ​lows on Wednesday after investors sold it aggressively when U.S. President Donald Trump seemed to ‌shrug off its recent decline, while Wall Street marched on to fresh record highs.】
